description: To fell One Austrian Pine at T50 within TPO 156
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The pine is a large, mature tree representing a prominent landscape feature which is visible from
the dwellings in Frithwood Avenue. The tree has a high amenity value and makes a positive
contribution to the visual and arboreal character of the local area.
Every year since 2020 we have received an application to fell this tree, no further evidence has
been supplied from the previous application to fell this Pine.
The application states that tree failure is both likely and foreseeable due to the uncorrected lean of
the main trunk and further crown displacement caused by the proximity of the adjacent oak trees.
The application goes into detail of the mechanism of failure being the root-plate lifting, precipitated
during a wet and windy weather event during which the soil could fail. However, the accuracy of this
information is questionable. The application has not been supported by any diagnostic information.
At the time of inspection, the tree was found to be in reasonable overall physi
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
